comments.subscription_id: Leave empty to use current logged-in subscription, or provide your Azure subscription GUID
comments.subscription_name: Leave empty to use current logged-in subscription, or provide subscription display name
comments.resource_group: Name of Azure resource group (will be created if it doesn't exist)
comments.location: Azure region (e.g., eastus, westus2, westeurope, northeurope)
comments.cluster_name: Name for your Arc-enabled Kubernetes cluster
comments.namespace_name: Name for Azure Device Registry namespace
comments.key_vault_name: OPTIONAL: Custom name for Azure Key Vault (must be globally unique). Leave empty to auto-generate
comments.container_registry: OPTIONAL: Container registry for edge modules (e.g., 'yourusername' for Docker Hub)
comments.skip_system_update: Set to true to skip Windows feature checks for faster runs
comments.force_reinstall: Set to true to reinstall components even if they already exist
comments.use_k3d: Set to true to use K3d (requires Docker Desktop) instead of WSL2 K3s

optional_tools.k9s: Terminal UI for Kubernetes cluster management. Enable for development/debugging.
optional_tools.mqtt-viewer: MQTT CLI tools (mosquitto_sub, mosquitto_pub). Enable for MQTT testing.

usage_instructions.step1: Copy this file to 'windows_aio_config.json' in the windows_build folder
usage_instructions.step2: Fill in your Azure subscription details (or leave empty to use current login)
usage_instructions.step3: Customize cluster_name and other settings as needed
usage_instructions.step5: After installation, run External-Configurator.ps1 from linux_build folder
